He had said he was able to wait for us until 9pm and had requested for us to call him at 8 to inform him of our location. We did as asked and informed him that we would make it around 9pm. At 9pm we called him to tell him that we were in the area and that we couldn‚Äôt locate parking. He yelled at us over the phone screaming where are you? Im waiting for you! We were grateful that he had waited for us but the screaming was unnecessary. After our stay he doubled the city tax that was written on the  reservation. After showing him what was written on our booking he pointed to a price on the wall and in a slow mocking tone started adding the price for three people for two nights. Maybe it was a communication error but his attitude was disgusting. Hotel guests should never be spoken down to especially when they try their best to communicate issues or concerns.

reviews.review_title: This hotel was the lowest point on my trip.
reviews.positive_text: Not everything is terrible about this hotel. The room was clean. The location is across the road from the beach. However it‚Äôs also right next to the railway tracks. I think only passenger trains use these tracks, which are not as noise as freight trains. But nevertheless a railway is not a pleasant neighbor.
reviews.negative_text:
Not everything is terrible about this hotel. But there were enough disappointments to make my stay at this hotel the lowest point of my vacation. The hotel is designed as a well, the sounds from the outside and especially from the inside are amplified. You hear loud and clear all the intimate details of what people in other rooms are doing - brushing their teeth, taking a shower, talking, using the toilet. 
Some genius affixed the toilet paper dispenser right above the toilet bowl, so you cannot sit normally on the toilet. You have to lean sideways because your right shoulder is pushing against the toilet paper dispenser. 
The WiFi was spotty, to put it mildly. It barely worked at all. 
But the worst was the reception staff. We were late to arrive at the hotel and the manager didn‚Äôt make any effort to accommodate our late arrival beyond sending me a message on Bioking.com asking about our arrival time and advising that the hotel doesn‚Äôt have night service. I didn‚Äôt get the message until I arrived at the hotel. The manager could have left me a note with my room number and leave the room open. At another hotel on this trip the manager left me the key in an envelope taped to the hotel door. This manager did no such thing, he made no effort at all. As a result we couldn‚Äôt get into our room and spent the first night in a car parked outside of the hotel. When the manager arrived in the morning, he was quite unapologetic. He didn‚Äôt even express any empathy towards our plight. 
I strongly recommend avoiding this hotel, unless you can plan everything in advance for your trip and you don‚Äôt mind crappy service, hearing everything your neighbors are doing and them hearing everything you‚Äôre doing.

The village is quite small and it wasn't crazy-packed with people at that time in the evening or the following morning.  There were a number of restaurants all smelling of delicious seafood.  The hotel, itself, is behind a restaurant front, with a courtyard and then the rooms behind that.  It was lovely and quiet.
